intro: Crucianella glauca subsp. kotschyi, commonly known as the Kotschyi's bluemink, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is a small shrub characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or white flowers. The species is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and parts of North Africa. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments. The plant's flowers are typically short-lived but attract various pollinators such as bees and moths.
